text: Jan Jindra (6 March 1932 - 20 September 2021) was a Czech rower. He competed for Czechoslovakia in the 1952 Summer Olympics, in the 1956 Summer Olympics, and in the 1960 Summer Olympics. He won a gold medal in 1952 and a bronze medal in 1960. Jindra was born in Třeboň, present-day Czech Republic. Jindra died on 20 September 2021 in Prague at the age of 89.Odešel třeboňský veslař, olympijský vítěz a dlouholetý předseda klubu Jan Jindra ==References== Category:1932 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Olympic gold medalists for the Czech Republic Category:Olympic gold medalists for Czechoslovakia Category:Olympic bronze medalists for the Czech Republic Category:Olympic bronze medalists for Czechoslovakia Category:Rowers
title: Jan Jindra
